search_results.snippet: The Treaty of Portsmouth and the Russo-Japanese War, 19041905. The Treaty of Portsmouth formally ended the Russo-Japanese War of 190405. The negotiations took place in August in Portsmouth, New Hampshire, and were brokered in part by U.S. President Theodore Roosevelt.

search_results.snippet: The Treaty of Portsmouth formally ended the 190405 Russo-Japanese War. It was signed on September 5, 1905 after negotiations lasting from August 6 to August 30, at the Portsmouth Naval Shipyard in Kittery, Maine, in the United States.
